intro: Chilita bocasana, commonly known as the Bocasana chilita, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Chilita bocasana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
